comment_data.body:
For additional context, the filetypedetect is defined this way:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/18358f50-a8c3-4100-8f26-07bc43b6b215)
Filetype detection is designed to _exactly_ mimic Vim's `filetype.vim`, which uses these events. Any such major change therefore has to be made there first.

I think instead of things using `BufAdd` and running their own "is this a directory" checks, maybe we could add a new `DirectoryRead` (name TBD) event that fires if 1) the path is a directory and (possibly) 2) no BufReadCmd events were fired for it.

This could allow file browser plugins like oil, netrw, etc. to have much simpler setup logic, as well as allow users to add on their own customizations/logic without needing to rely on plugins to provide their own hookpoints?
That would also have to go through Vim.

I don't like Neovim rely on or mimic Vim's builtin plugin. filetypedetect as a basic editor functionality doesn't need to follow Vim. If all functions same as Vim, what is the point to rewriting them as lua?
Performance. This is not up for debate; take it or leave it.

https://github.com/vim/vim/issues/16259

I have created the issue in Vim.

I don't think dir read is the solution, filetype should work on every buffer at the first place, include directory, and if a FileRead event is not exist, so does DirRead shouldn't, especially filetype doesn't rely on filesystem, it's a basic editor functionality and should not coupled with file/dir.

Hm...  It seems different issue.

I think `DirRead` is needed for file explorer plugin, but it is independent of filetype detection feature.

I'm not sure in what context one would want to open a directory like a file and set a custom "file"type on it \*outside* of the context of a file-explorer or at least a conceptually similar plugin.

like, you can't really *do* anything all that useful with a "directory" buffer without the use of plugins.

Directory is just a file, vim attach file in buffer, there is no needs to treat it different than other buffer, a directory filetype should be there at the first place, for syntax highlight and many filetype specific plugin, vim use filetype option, there is no reason to not use it in file explore, so no extra events is needed, and no more custom hacking autocmd.

> Directory is just a file, vim attach file in buffer, there is no needs to treat it different than other buffer, a directory filetype should be there at the first place, for syntax highlight and many filetype specific plugin, vim use filetype option, there is no reason to not use it in file explore, so no extra events is needed, and no more custom hacking autocmd.

Could you please demonstrate with specific code why you believe the current issues with the file explorer plugin will be resolved by using `directory` filetype?
I have developed file explorer plugins and am well-versed in this area.
It's inconsistent for me that filetypedetect ignoring directory buffer.

> I just load file explorer plugin on directory filetype, to do that I use custom autocmd to assign directory filetype.

It is possible.
Note: `BufAdd` is unsuitable for this purpose due to its internal specifications though.

But you can done by new autocmd.
Why it must be `filetype`?  I want to know the advantage than other implementation.
It's more intuitive, I was confuse by figuring out how to load file explorer in exact timing, but it turns out adding a directory filetype is a good solution for me.

Why you say that BufAdd isn't suitable?
Isn't BufAdd just before bufenter so it's a good timing for filetypedetect?
```lua
{
  buf = 16,
  event = "BufAdd",
  file = "C:\\Users\\wenjie\\AppData\\Local\\nvim\\dev\\hc-nvim\\lua\\hc-nvim\\setup\\filetype.lua",
  id = 27,
  match = "C:/Users/wenjie/AppData/Local/nvim/dev/hc-nvim/lua/hc-nvim/setup/filetype.lua"
}
{
  buf = 16,
  event = "BufEnter",
  file = "C:\\Users\\wenjie\\AppData\\Local\\nvim\\dev\\hc-nvim\\lua\\hc-nvim\\setup\\filetype.lua",
  id = 27,
  match = "C:/Users/wenjie/AppData/Local/nvim/dev/hc-nvim/lua/hc-nvim/setup/filetype.lua"
}
```

Pretty sure loading a file browser plugin late breaks opening a directory from the command line (e.g., `nvim .`, I believe the buffers are created before plugins are loaded, and plugins like netrw/oil therefore have to check existing buffers on `VimEnter`) so it's not something most people are likely to do. And even if that wasn't an issue, I think `filetype` is the wrong place to solve that anyway. If we wanted to improve directory handling in Neovim I would seriously suggest a new autocommand event type be added.

While this suggestion was already met with 'this would have to go through Vim' I'm not entirely convinced that's true? Neovim has a number of bespoke autocommand events not present in Vim, such as the channel and UI events, but I believe there's also some cursor and mode related ones?

Yes, but those are all N/A in Vim. For anything that relates to both (as this definitely would), we prefer Vim to have the first word instead of the last (to avoid them implementing it later in an incompatible fashion).

> I would seriously suggest a new autocommand event type be added.

Discuss it in https://github.com/vim/vim/issues/16259 . Let's not repeat it halfway in multiple places.

> Yes, but those are all N/A in Vim. For anything that relates to both (as this definitely would), we prefer Vim to have the first word instead of the last (to avoid them implementing it later in an incompatible fashion).

not all!


<details>
<summary>diff of non-neovim-feature-specific autocommand events between neovim (current head) and vim (9.1)</summary>

\+ = neovim
\- = vim
```diff
+BufModifiedSet
+CmdWinEnter
+CmdWinLeave
-CmdwinEnter
-CmdwinLeave
-KeyInputPre
+RecordingEnter
+RecordingLeave
-SafeStateAgain
+SearchWrapped
-SigUSR1
+Signal
+TabNewEntered
-WinNewPre
```
</details>

but yes, I concur, that discussion is maybe better suited elsewhere.

labels.description: upstream issue that must be fixed in Vim first
labels.name: needs:vim-patch

milestone.description: We don't plan to work on this, but will accept high quality contributions from someone who will own the feature and follow up on bug reports.
milestone.title: needs-owner

title: Directory filetype

type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality
type.name: Enhancement
